title: For $640K, a Martha’s Vineyard ‘gingerbread house’ measuring 354 square feet
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: Real Estate Referred as “Baby Vineyard," this colorful cottage in Martha's Vineyard's Oak Bluffs is "an affordable way to get your foot in the door.
” 2 Lincoln Avenue in Oak Bluffs.
Dania Alyse Photography One of New England’s most notorious (and colorful) communities is awaiting its newest resident.

title: Why Boston can’t quit the espresso martini
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food Some theories from bartenders: It's like an iced Dunkin but with vodka, or the grown-up, classy version of a Boston college student's favorite vodka Redbull.
Baleia in the South End makes their take on an espresso martini, seen here and named the Mazagran Martini.

title: These young adults make good money. But life, they say, is unaffordable.
author: New York Times Service
bullets: National News Economists say that a typical middle-class family today is richer than one in the 1960s.
Americans in their 20s and 30s don’t believe it.
Alicia Wrigley and her husband, Richard Gailey, both musicians and teachers, live in Salt Lake City with their 2-year-old.

title: From TreVeyon Henderson to offensive tackle depth, injuries are piling up for the Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Sunday night's physical matchup in Baltimore left the Patriots banged up.
TreVeyon Henderson AP Photo/Stephanie Scarbrough TreVeyon Henderson played just 14 offensive snaps on Sunday, leaving the game early with a head injury in the second quarter.
The mark tied a season-low for the rookie, and was one of several injuries the Patriots sustained during their win.

title: What Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of Tuesday’s snow
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Weather "Light snow breaks out tomorrow, whitening the ground for many just before Christmas.
" ShareSend this article to your social connections.

National Weather Service: ‘Accumulations are expected to range from 1 to 3 inches along and west of I-95’ Accumulating snowfall is likely on Tuesday especially away from the south coast, beginning in the morning and ending in the evening.

title: AFC Playoff Picture: Where the Patriots stand after beating the Ravens
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots are currently the No.
2 seed, but that could change depending on what happens with Denver and Buffalo.
Rhamondre Stevenson Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff Sunday’s win over the Ravens officially put the Patriots in the playoffs for the first time since 2022.
